answers.answer: Hello,You seem to be having erectile dysfunction. Common causes causing erection problem are stress and anxiety,poor communication with your partner, unrealistic sexual expectations, which make sex a task rather than a pleasure,negative feelings about non performance,smoking, alcohol and sometimes illicit drugs and medical conditions like diabetes, high blood pressure, heart or thyroid conditions, poor circulation, low testosterone, depression, spinal cord or neurological problems. Some of the drugs associated with this are blood pressure medications (especially beta-blockers), heart medications (such as digoxin), some peptic ulcer medications, sleeping pills, and antidepressants. Just check out the medications and if you are not taking any then all these causes ruled out.I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and regards.

I thank you for your answer, but I'm under no stress or anxiety and i'm not experiencing any sort of premature ejaculation......its like my PC muscle is contracting, but barely anything comes out and w/ no force......it used to literally shoot out the volume was extremely high

question: hey everyone,I'm 24 years old, very healthy, work out on a constant basis and eat  healthy.  I've always had a decent amount of ejaculation and it was very forceful and would "shoot" out.  However, about a year ago I began to notice that the amount of ejaculate didn't seem as much and my orgasms are no longer forceful whatsoever.  It does not shoot out like it did and it pretty much drips out weakly.  Also, it seems that my PC muscle is contracting like it used to, but nothing is coming out.....was just wondering if anyone could give me some advice....thanks
title: Decreased Ejaculation Volume/Force
